info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 2 at 10:02AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Black River At Corning affecting Clay County.
For the Black River...including Corning, Pocahontas, Black Rock... Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Black River at Corning.
* WHEN...From Monday evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Most of the area inside the levees is flooded. Homes and cabins along the river will be isolated or flooded. Backwater prevents adequate rainfall runoff in Corning area.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 3.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Monday evening and continue rising to 15.0 feet Monday evening. This crest is based off of forecasted rainfall for the next three days. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for updates. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 72 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1015 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
